main event: An observer reported seeing a bright star-like object in Wheaton, Maryland on 5 October 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as having a tail that was brighter in the middle and flashed at intervals., The sighting lasted approximately 30 seconds., The object completely disappeared before reappearing a few seconds later., The object was possibly identified as the star Formalhaut., The observation was made while the observer was driving a car.
witness description: the observer had an amateur interest in astronomy
